attributes.comment:
Hello,
I have read the detailed analysis presented by USCIS on this proposal and
applaud their efforts.
While it may be necessary to propose fee increases,

I believe there should be a reasonable assurance about faster processing also.
At least some steps should be taken as added benefit related to the fee change.

This will help USCIS easily support the free change.

Some possible benefits USCIS can provide and save costs for all.

a) Make all the above forms electronically filable
b) Remove restrictions on wait time to file some forms like I 485
(Currently the retrogression makes some people wait for as long as 4 years to just
file this form)

Some indirect benefits of doing this:

1) Ability to file form electronically right away leads to benefit of applying for I-765
(EAD) within 6 months based on pending I-485

2) This is a great benefit to the 1.3 Million people who apply for an I-765 (EAD)
currently. They can potentially obtain their work permits and also obtain work
permits for their eligible dependents.
This would increase tax dollars to the economy as several of them will chose to
work and pay their taxes.

3) An approved EAD provides flexibility for an immigrant to shift employers also
based on AC 21.
This is the most important benefit of permanent residence: Ability to work for any
employer without any processing. And having it will reduce the anxiety of having to
wait for a Permanent Residence card to be acquired several years later.

4) This way by making a simple related procedural change, USCIS can satisfy the
hearts of several immigrants who indeed will eventually contribute to the economy
as they have over the last 500 years
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Mahesh Yelisetti
